Statewide Course: CAPSTONE REVIEW COURSE OF ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES
Prerequisites: ACG 2021, ACG 2071, ACG 2100, APA 2135, APA 2136, ACG 2450, AND TAX 2000; AND GEB 2214 OR ENC 2210.
Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES THE STUDENT WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO INTEGRATE INFORMATION AND SKILLS FROM PRIOR ACCOUNTING, SOFTWARE, BUSINESS, AND COMMUNICATION COURSES THROUGH A VARIETY OF PROJECTS AND WORKPLACE SCENARIOS. A COMPREHENSIVE ACCOUNTING SIMULATION MAY BE USED TO DEMONSTRATE FLUENCY WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING AND RECORD KEEPING. COMPLETION OF THE COURSE REQUIRES SUCCESSFUL ACHIEVEMENT OF THE PROGRAM'S LEARNING OUTCOMES. THIS COURSE MUST BE TAKEN IN THE STUDENT'S FINAL SEMESTER OF STUDY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT IS ABLE TO:
1. INTEGRATE ACCOUNTING SKILLS AND TECHNIQUES ACQUIRED IN PREVIOUS COURSES. 
2. PREPARE A COMPLETE FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS. 
3. IDENTIFY AND USE ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS AND FINANCIAL DATA TO MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT THE OPERATING PERFORMANCE AND FINANCIAL POSITION OF A COMPANY.
4. DEVELOP A PERSONAL CODE OF ETHICS BY EXPLORING ETHICAL DILEMMAS WITHIN THE ACCOUNTING FIELD. 
5. DEVELOP A CAREER PLAN FOR AN ACCOUNTING POSITION IN THE WORKFORCE.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
